title: Eagle
description: Primary body parts engaged Glutes & Hip Flexors, Shoulders, Upper Back & Lower Traps Ankles, Middle Back / Lats, Quadriceps, Wrists Strengthens legs; stretches shoulders and upper back Improves coordination and balance Stand with your feet together. Bend your knees slightly. Cross your right thigh over your left thigh with an inhale. Hook your right toes behind your calf. Raise your arms to shoulder height with an inhale. Cross your right arm under your left arm with an exhale. Bend your elbows and bring your palms to touch. Gaze at one point ahead of you. Hold the pose and take slow, deep breaths.
alignment_cues: Maintain steady breath throughout the pose
Keep proper alignment based on pose type
Listen to your body and modify as needed
